channel.title: Java settings
channel.description:
is there a way of setting the java options (for agents) progmatically? i don't think end users would be able to use the java control panel without fucking things up.
Something like a plugin for Chrome (probably can't be done, mind
sorry if you can't understand, i'm fucked

item.title: Java settings
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

No dont think it is possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Java settings
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:4, topic:394600”]The Enforcer means:

VirtualMachine vm = VirtualMachine.attach("2177"); Properties props = vm.getSystemProperties(); String home = props.getProperty("java.home"); String agent = home + File.separator + "lib" + File.separator + "agent.jar"; vm.loadAgent(agent); vm.detach();

[edit]
read this: http://blogs.oracle.com/CoreJavaTechTips/entry/the_attach_api
[/edit][/quote]
Thanks. I have been doing it like this, but is there any way of loading the agent without having to pack it into a jar?

Read full topic

item.title: Java settings
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

super_:

might note that modifying deployment.properties is risky and tends to fail in a seemingly random fashion. in my experience it has no effect on applets in the past year

It might be because you upgrade your java version and the deployement properties needs to then include the agent settings for the new version.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

The Enforcer means:

VirtualMachine vm = VirtualMachine.attach("2177"); Properties props = vm.getSystemProperties(); String home = props.getProperty("java.home"); String agent = home + File.separator + "lib" + File.separator + "agent.jar"; vm.loadAgent(agent); vm.detach();

[edit]
read this: http://blogs.oracle.com/CoreJavaTechTips/entry/the_attach_api
[/edit]

item.title: Java settings
item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

If you want to attach an agent in the live phase you can use the Attach API.

Read full topic
